description: Variation of gast, from Middle English gasten, from Old English gāstan (“to meditate”) and gǣstan (“to gast, frighten, afflict, torment”). More at gast. Spelling influenced by ghost.

verbs.description: ghast (third-person singular simple present ghasts, present participle ghasting, simple past and past participle ghasted)

description: Poetic abbreviation of ghastly. Use as a noun influenced by ghost.

adjectives.description: ghast (comparative more ghast, superlative most ghast)

entries.meaning: (fantasy) An evil spirit or monster; a ghoul.
